Hmmm, let's examine that, shall we?

George HW Bush
Born to family wealth (His father, Prescott, was in banking and also fought with the AEF in WW1)
Enlisted in the Navy out of high school to fly torpedo bombers, becoming one of the youngest combat pilots in WW2, earning the Air Medal (with 3 ribbon devices) and the Distinguished Flying Cross
Post war, graduated Yale in 2.5 years, majoring in economics and minoring in sociology
Moved to west Texas and co-founded an oil drilling company
At age 42, he won a seat in Congress
In 1970 he was appointed US ambassador to the UN
In 1972 he became chair of the RNC
In 1976 he became Director of the CIA
In 1980 he was elected VP
In 1988 he was elected President
George W Bush
Born to family wealth
Graduated Yale in 1968 with a BA in history
Graduated Harvard Business in 1975 with an MBA
Noted bibliophile
Admitted "average" student (77) in high school/undergrad, enjoyed drinking and carousing
TX Air National Guard from 1968-1974
Started his own oil exploration business in 1977, merger with larger conglomerates in 1984 and becoming chairman
In 1989 led a group of investors to buy the TX Rangers baseball team, selling his interests in 1998, making $15M on an $800K investment
Governor of TX from 1995-2000
Elected President in 2000
Donald Trump (To be continued)...

Donald Trump
Born to wealth (father prospered in Queens real estate development)
1968 graduates Wharton Business with a BA in economics. Claimed several times to have finished first in his class but no evidence exists he made the honor roll...
Obtaining several draft deferments, the board eventually found him fit but he was later deemed 4-F from bone spurs
During and after Wharton, worked for his father's real estate company, becoming president in 1971
In 1978 he shifted his interests from Queens middle class housing to Manhattan real estate and construction
Trump built a luxury real estate empire, marketed heavily under his name, eventually expanding into casinos and golf resorts
Well known for heavily leveraging his business interests to expand his empire and personal wealth
Also well known for protecting his personal assets through strategic bankruptcies when a business venture, notably his casinos, fail
Considered by many, prior to his foray into politics, a master marketer of himself and ostentacious living
Many varied business ventures, books, media appearances, and co-producer and host of various editions of The Apprentice
Often asked during interviews whether he would run for office. Ironically, the commentators assumed he was a Democrat
Insults his way to the Republican nomination in 2016
Elected President
